required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 22, 2015
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment of Recently Acquired Genotype 1 Hepatitis C With the 3D Regimen
clinical_study.official_title: An Open Label, Multicentre, International Pilot Study of Paritaprevir/Ritonavir, Ombitasvir, Dasabuvir With or Without Ribavirin for People With Recently Acquired Hepatitis C Virus Infection With or Without HIV Co-infection.

oversight_info.authority: Australia: Department of Health and Ageing Therapeutic Goods Administration
Australia: National Health and Medical Research Council

brief_summary.textblock: An open label, multicentre, international pilot study of paritaprevir/ritonavir, ombitasvir, dasabuvir with or without ribavirin for people with recently acquired hepatitis C virus infection with or without HIV co-infection.

detailed_description.textblock:
The use of a highly potent IFN-sparing drug combination in the setting of recently acquired genotype (GT) 1 HCV infection is hypothesised to result in the vast majority of patients achieving SVR. In this setting, it is anticipated that therapy can be shortened relative to that used in established chronic infection. A short course IFN-free strategy is likely to be highly attractive to both patients and clinicians and if proven may further encourage early HCV testing and diagnosis.
In this pilot study, the investigators plan to explore the safety, efficacy and feasibility of the IFN-sparing combination of paritaprevir/ritonavir/ombitasvir, dasabuvir and ribavirin for 8 (and then potentially 6) weeks in patients with documented recently acquired GT 1 HCV infection.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of treated subjects (intention-to-treat (ITT) population) demonstrating undetectable hepatitis C virus (HCV) RNA at 12 weeks following treatment (SVR 12).

secondary_outcome.measure: The proportion of treated subjects overall with ETR, SVR4 and SVR24 defined as undetectable HCV RNA at end of therapy, 4 weeks and 24 weeks post therapy, respectively.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of treatment- week 6 or week 8 depending on the study arm; 4 weeks post treatment; 24 weeks post treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of ETR, SVR4, SVR12 and SVR24 between those receiving 8 weeks treatment and those receiving 6 weeks treatment.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of treatment- week 6 or week 8 depending on the study arm; 4 weeks post treatment; 12 weeks post treatment; 24 weeks post treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of adherence between those receiving 8 weeks treatment and those receiving 6 weeks treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to week 6 or week 8 treatment duration
Baseline through to 6 or 8 weeks depending on the study arm

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion with adverse events (including serious adverse events)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to week 6 or week 8 treatment duration

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in laboratory parameters, including liver function tests (ALT, AST) and haematological indices (haemoglobin, neutrophil count, platelet count)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to week 6 or week 8 treatment duration
Baseline through to 6 or 8 weeks depending on the study arm

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in sexual and injecting drug use behaviour at SVR 12 and end of follow up
Serum cytokine and ISG expression at baseline and week 4

arm_group.description: Paritaprevir/ritonavir/ombitasvir (75mg/50mg/12.5mg) and dasabuvir (250mg) with or without ribavirin (1000-1200mg) daily taken orally for 8 weeks.
Paritaprevir/ritonavir/ombitasvir (75mg/50mg/12.5mg) and dasabuvir (250mg) with or without ribavirin (1000-1200mg) daily taken orally for 6 weeks.
